summary: This is an email forwarding information from a Winston & Strawn legal submission regarding Jeffrey Epstein. It references an assistant who rented a car for a victim and coordinated the delivery of roses to a victim at a high school event, citing specific messages from 'Epstein Records'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; the document references records and actions related to him.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Recipient or involved party in the correspondence from the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: The AUSA is part of the office prosecuting Epstein, as indicated by the document's metadata.

events.title: Delivery of roses to victim
events.description: An assistant for Epstein coordinated the delivery of roses to a victim at a high school event, as detailed in a message from 'Epstein Records'.

events.title: Car rental contract expiration
events.description: A car rental contract for a Blue Dodge Neon, rented by an Epstein assistant for a victim, was set to expire on February 2nd.

keyFacts: An assistant for Jeffrey Epstein rented a car for one of Epstein's victims.
The same assistant coordinated the delivery of roses to a victim at a high school event, with specific instructions for timing and delivery.
The document cites 'Epstein Records' from a public records request to the Office of the State Attorney.
The information was part of a legal submission by the law firm Winston & Strawn.
